TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit BicepFunction extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides access to standard Bicep functions.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Azure.Provisioning.BicepValue<string> AsString (Azure.Provisioning.BicepValue<object> value);

Public Shared Function AsString (value As BicepValue(Of Object)) As BicepValue(Of String)
static member AsString : Azure.Provisioning.BicepValue<obj> -> Azure.Provisioning.BicepValue<string>

Docs.param: The value to convert to string. Any type of value can be converted, including objects and arrays.
Docs.summary: Converts the specified value to a string. Strings are returned as-is. Other types are converted to their equivalent JSON representation. This represents the string Bicep function.
Docs.returns: A string of the converted value.
Docs.remarks:
See the
Bicep Functions Reference for more.

Docs.param: Strings in sequential order for concatenation.
Docs.summary: Combines multiple string values and returns the concatenated string. This represents the concat Bicep function. To improve readability, prefer instead of .
Docs.returns: A string or array of concatenated values.
Docs.remarks:
See the

MemberSignature.Value: public static Azure.Provisioning.BicepValue<string> CreateGuid (params Azure.Provisioning.BicepValue<string>[] values);
.method public static hidebysig class Azure.Provisioning.BicepValue`1<string> CreateGuid(class Azure.Provisioning.BicepValue`1<string>[] values) cil managed
Public Shared Function CreateGuid (ParamArray values As BicepValue(Of String)()) As BicepValue(Of String)
static member CreateGuid : Azure.Provisioning.BicepValue<string>[] -> Azure.Provisioning.BicepValue<string>

Docs.param: The value used in the hash function to create the GUID. At least one value is required.
Docs.summary: Creates a value in the format of a globally unique identifier based on the values provided as parameters. This represents the guid Bicep function.
Docs.returns: A string containing 36 characters in the format of a globally unique identifier.

remarks.para: This function is helpful when you need to create a value in the format of a globally unique identifier. You provide parameter values that limit the scope of uniqueness for the result. You can specify whether the name is unique down to subscription, resource group, or deployment.
The returned value isn't a random string, but rather the result of a hash function on the parameters. The returned value is 36 characters long. It isn't globally unique.
NOTE: The order of the parameters affects the returned value. For example, CreateGuid("Hello", "World") and CreateGuid("World", "Hello") don't return the same value.

See the
Bicep Functions Reference for more.

Public Shared Function GetDeployment () As ArmDeployment

Docs.summary: Returns information about the current deployment operation. This represents the deployment Bicep function.
Docs.returns: This function returns the object that is passed during deployment. The properties in the returned object differ based on whether you are deploying a local Bicep file or deploying to a resource group / subscription / management group / tenant.
Docs.remarks:
See the
Bicep Functions Reference for more.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Azure.Provisioning.BicepValue<Azure.Core.ResourceIdentifier> GetSubscriptionResourceId (params Azure.Provisioning.BicepValue<string>[] values);

.method public static hidebysig class Azure.Provisioning.BicepValue`1<class Azure.Core.ResourceIdentifier> GetSubscriptionResourceId(class Azure.Provisioning.BicepValue`1<string>[] values) cil managed
Public Shared Function GetSubscriptionResourceId (ParamArray values As BicepValue(Of String)()) As BicepValue(Of ResourceIdentifier)
static member GetSubscriptionResourceId : Azure.Provisioning.BicepValue<string>[] -> Azure.Provisioning.BicepValue<Azure.Core.ResourceIdentifier>

Docs.param: Optional subscription id, resource types, and resource names used to construct the resource ID. At least two values are required.
Docs.summary: Returns the unique identifier for a resource deployed at the subscription level. This represents the subscriptionResourceId Bicep function.
Docs.returns: The unique identifier for a resource deployed at the subscription level.

remarks.para: The identifier is returned in the following format: /subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/providers/{resourceProviderNamespace}/{resourceType}/{resourceName}

You use this function to get the resource ID for resources that are deployed to the subscription rather than a resource group. The returned ID differs from the value returned by the resourceId function by not including a resource group value.

See the
Bicep Functions Reference for more.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Azure.Provisioning.BicepValue<string> GetUniqueString (params Azure.Provisioning.BicepValue<string>[] values);
.method public static hidebysig class Azure.Provisioning.BicepValue`1<string> GetUniqueString(class Azure.Provisioning.BicepValue`1<string>[] values) cil managed
Public Shared Function GetUniqueString (ParamArray values As BicepValue(Of String)()) As BicepValue(Of String)
static member GetUniqueString : Azure.Provisioning.BicepValue<string>[] -> Azure.Provisioning.BicepValue<string>

Docs.param: The value used in the hash function to create a unique string. At least one value is required.
Docs.summary: Creates a deterministic hash string based on the provided as parameters. This represents the uniqueString Bicep function.

remarks.para: This function is helpful when you need to create a unique name for a resource. You provide parameter values that limit the scope of uniqueness for the result. You can specify whether the name is unique down to subscription, resource group, or deployment.

The returned value isn't a random string, but rather the result of a hash function. The returned value is 13 characters long. It isn't globally unique. You may want to combine the value with a prefix from your naming convention to create a name that is meaningful.

See the
Bicep Functions Reference for more.

Docs.param: The string to take the elements from.
The number of characters to take. If this value is 0 or less, an empty string is returned. If it's larger than the length of the given string, all the characters in the string are returned.
Docs.summary: Returns a string with the specified number of characters from the start of the string. This represents the take Bicep function.
Docs.remarks:
See the
Bicep Functions Reference for more.
